title.native: 出ましたっ！パワパフガールズZ

description:
Based on the American cartoon, "The Powerpuff Girls."

Professor Utonium and his son Ken are studying the strange Chemical X. When a mochi cake falls into the formula, it changes into Chemical Z. Ken fires a ray of Chemical Z at a glacier in Tokyo Bay, however that causes strange black and white lights to scatter. The black lights turn its victims into monsters, with emphasis on a black light hitting a zoo monkey and transforming him into Mojo Jojo.

The white lights, however, aim at three normal girls, Momoko, Miyako, and Kaoru. This gives them the power to transform into superheroes, the Powerpuff Girls Z!
synonyms: And They're Off! Powerpuff Girls Z

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Makeup
tags.description: Centers around the makeup industry.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Football
tags.description: Centers around the sport of football (known in the USA as "soccer").

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Fashion
tags.description: Centers around the fashion industry.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Wrestling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of wrestling.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Kids
tags.description: Target demographic is young children.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

node.description:
[Website](https://www.nanakitade.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/PRINCESSNANA73) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/nanakitade_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nana_kitade/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/princess.nanakitade/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwzCuUrseqIMlWuICM1U_sQ)

Nana Kitade (北出 菜奈) is a J-rock singer signed onto Sony Music Japan. Nana is particularly famous for wearing Gothic Lolita fashion, something she has in common with many of her fans. She has become a fashion icon for many teenage girls and is popular in the Lolita subculture.  She writes all of her lyrics, while Susumu Nishikawa and Akimitsu Homma deal with almost all compositions of her music.
He's the original creator of the 3-time Emmy nominated, Powerpuff Girls (later turned into an anime in Japan)

Hearts Grow was a Japanese band from Motobu, Okinawa. Their first single Grow!! was released independently (in limited quantities) on 19 April 2006. Hearts Grow made their major label debut on 18 October 2006, with the release of their first single Road. Their second single Yurayura (ユラユラ) was released in Japan on 6 December 2006. They are known for performing the ninth opening of Naruto, the fourth ending of Demashita! Powerpuff Girls Z, the fourth opening for Gintama and the first opening of Tetsuwan Birdy: Decode.

As of late 2010 the band has been on an indefinite hiatus. The lead singer Haruna plans on a solo career.


**Current Line-up**
- Haruna (ハルナ, 1986.10.27) - Vocal
- Chiaki (チアキ, 1986.10.23) - Keyboards & Vocal
- Natsumi (ナツミ, 1987.05.24) - Guitar
- Shintarou (シンタロウ, 1987.02.15) - Guitar
- Yuusuke (ユウスケ, 1988.02.17) - Bass

**Former Members**
- Yuuya (ユウヤ, 1987.01.26) - Drums

HALCALI is a Japanese rap-pop duo from Meguro, Tokyo. Its two members, Haruka (Halca) and Yukari (Yucali) also comprise the group’s name; a concatenation of "Haru" and "kari." Haruka, born April 21, 1988 and Yukari, born July 18, 1987 originally met as finalists at a hip-hop audition held in a local school in the Meguro district, where both were born.  At their inception, the girls were produced by Oshare Track Factory (OTF) comprised of producing artists RIP SLYME, RYO-Z and DJ Fumiya and signed to Tokyo-based record label, For-Life Music Entertainment (FLME).  (Source: last.fm)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oja0222digi)

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since 1987.

[Seki-sensei](https://anilist.co/character/14098/) in [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) is named after her.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/下笠美穂)

Noted for her work as an animation director on the [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) series.

Married to [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/下笠美穂)

Noted for her work as an animation director on the [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) series.

Married to [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jorgevasconcellosdub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100091905272928)

Jorge José Vasconcellos Paulo is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer, and dubbing director.

In 2007 he won a Yamato Award for Best Supporting Voice Actor, as the voice of Principal Pixiefrog in the cartoon My Gym Partner's a Monkey.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Brad Garrett, Giancarlo Esposito, Gil Birmingham, Tobin Bell, Alan Rickman and Rob Morgan (Most of the productions)
- Mojo Jojo (The Powerpuff Girls 1998)
- The Red Guy / The Devil (I Am Weasel and Cow and Chicken)

- Taneleer Tivan / The Collector (Marvel Cinematographic Universe)
- Victor Creed / Sabretooth (X-Men 2000 and Deadpool & Wolverine)
- Tina Rex (The Amazing World of Gumball)
- Captain Gutt (Ice Age: Continental Drift)
- Dr. Jumba Jookiba (Lilo & Stitch franchise)
- Waylon Smithers, Jr. (10th voice - 33rd season onwards; The Simpsons)
- Doctor Aloysius James Animo / Doctor Animo / D'Void (Ben 10 franchise)
- Severus Snape (Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 1 and 2 and Harry Potter for Kinect)

- Brock Fitzgerald Samson (The Venture Bros.)

- Charles "Charlie" Strong (Peaky Blinders)
- Nestor (Happy Feet 1 and 2)
- Mr. Harrington (Meet the Robinsons)
!~
